articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in D# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in D# (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is the playing of the tones of a chord in succession, giving it a unique and melodic sound. The Minor 7th arpeggio in D# (with the shape of C) consists of the notes D#-F#-A#-C#.

## Notes and Intervals
- D# (Root)
- F# (Minor 3rd)
- A# (Perfect 5th)
- C# (Minor 7th)

This arpeggio creates a moody and jazzy sound due to the minor tonality and inclusion of the minor 7th interval.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
*The Minor 7th arpeggio in D# is commonly found in jazz, blues, R&B, and funk music genres. It adds a soulful and sophisticated flavor to the music, often expressing emotion and depth in compositions.*

## Songs Featuring the Minor 7th Arpeggio in D# (Shape: C)
1. **"Autumn Leaves" by Joseph Kosma** - This jazz standard features the Minor 7th arpeggio prominently in various sections of the song, providing a rich harmonic texture.
  
2. **"I Heard It Through the Grapevine" by Marvin Gaye** - In this classic R&B hit, the Minor 7th arpeggio is subtly used to enhance the soulful vibe of the song.

3. **"Cissy Strut" by The Meters** - This funk instrumental piece showcases the groove of the Minor 7th arpeggio, adding a funky and rhythmic feel to the composition.

Utilizing the Minor 7th arpeggio in D# (Shape: C) can add depth and emotion to musical compositions, making it a valuable tool for musicians across various genres.
